candidates.name: Vicky Southworth
candidates.why_elect: I've completed a Master of Water Resources from the University of Canterbury following 15 years of scientific and planning experience. I'm involved with restoration planting locally. I've advocated for biodiversity and water quality as a community representative on a regional committee gaining a sense of what works and what doesn't.
candidates.why_stand: We are faced with climate change globally, huge losses in native biodiversity nationally and nitrate and other water pollution issues locally. These things are all linked. I can bring my skills to work collaboratively to find the balance we need to prosper whilst protecting the natural resources we care about.

candidates.name: Rik Tindall
candidates.why_elect: Open and honest, I will hit the ground running based on wide, relevant experience: ECan Councillor Christchurch East 2007-10; Spreydon-Heathcote Community Board 2013-16; Christchurch Estuary Association 2009-18; Cashmere Residents' Association 2011-18; Predator Free Port Hills 2016-19 etc. Christchurch-born, six years travel away, self-employed IT professional, always volunteering eg civil defence.
candidates.why_stand: Environment-Canterbury needs help. Pressured from all sides, with competing resource uses, it can seldom make everyone happy. Indeed ECan receives the most blame, for both doing too much and never enough. So I will help hear and represent community views, bringing fair balance to decisions where this is much needed.

candidates.name: Phil Clearwater
candidates.why_elect: I have been a longstanding Community Board Chair, and a Christchurch City Councillor for two terms, chairing committees on infrastructure, transport, environment and community development. I will bring integrity, experience, skills and leadership essential for a new, democratic ECan.
candidates.why_stand: I believe we are the guardians of our environment. In Canterbury there has never been greater need to protect our pristine water which is at serious risk. The need for environmental action and transport transformation is urgent.

candidates.name: James Macbeth Dann
candidates.why_elect: I have strong connections to a number of communities, groups, and local organisations. My background in science allows me to process some of the complex information regularly presented to ECan, while my experience in the media allows me to communicate that to constituents clearly and understandably.
candidates.why_stand: ECan has lacked leadership for a decade—because the previous government sacked ECan. Now that we have a chance to elect our regional council, I want to be part of it, to bring strong environmental leadership back to the Canterbury region.

candidates.name: Hamish Keown
candidates.why_elect: I will bring a different view due to my age and experiences. I've worked in both the community and government space for a few years, and have also held a number of positions that have required me to make decisions on complex issues.
candidates.why_stand: I am standing for Environment Canterbury because I am deeply invested in the protection and enhancement of our environment and community.
